chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
h: nat -> nat
g: nat -> nat
f: nat -> nat

Goal:
bijection n g h -> ∑ n f = ∑ n (fun i : nat => f (g i))

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive bijection (n : nat) (g h : nat -> nat) : Prop := in_bij : (forall i : nat, i < n -> g i < n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> h i < n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> g (h i) = i) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> h (g i) = i) -> bijection n g h Arguments bijection _%nat_scope (_ _)%function_scope Arguments in_bij [n]%nat_scope (_ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
sum_bounded_permutation : forall (n i j : nat) (g f : nat -> nat), bounded_permut n i j g -> ∑ n f = ∑ n (fun i0 : nat => f (g i0))
sum_injective : forall (n : nat) (f g : nat -> nat), bounded_injective n g -> ∑ n f = ∑ n (fun i : nat => f (g i))
sum_composed_permutation : forall (n : nat) (f g : nat -> nat), composed_permutation n g -> ∑ n f = ∑ n (fun i : nat => f (g i))
sum_0n_scal_r : forall (n k : nat) (f : nat -> nat), ∑ n (fun i : nat => f i * k) = ∑ n f * k
sum_0n_mono : forall (n : nat) (f g : nat -> nat), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i <= g i) -> ∑ n f <= ∑ n g
sum_0n_scal_l : forall (n k : nat) (f : nat -> nat), ∑ n (fun i : nat => k * f i) = k * ∑ n f
in_bij : forall (n : nat) (g h : nat -> nat), (forall i : nat, i < n -> g i < n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> h i < n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> g (h i) = i) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> h (g i) = i) -> bijection n g h
bijection_rec : forall (n : nat) (g h : nat -> nat) (P : bijection n g h -> Set), (forall (l : forall i : nat, i < n -> g i < n) (l0 : forall i : nat, i < n -> h i < n) (e : forall i : nat, i < n -> g (h i) = i) (e0 : forall i : nat, i < n -> h (g i) = i), P (in_bij g h l l0 e e0)) -> forall b : bijection n g h, P b
bijection_sind : forall (n : nat) (g h : nat -> nat) (P : bijection n g h -> SProp), (forall (l : forall i : nat, i < n -> g i < n) (l0 : forall i : nat, i < n -> h i < n) (e : forall i : nat, i < n -> g (h i) = i) (e0 : forall i : nat, i < n -> h (g i) = i), P (in_bij g h l l0 e e0)) -> forall b : bijection n g h, P b
bijection_ind : forall (n : nat) (g h : nat -> nat) (P : bijection n g h -> Prop), (forall (l : forall i : nat, i < n -> g i < n) (l0 : forall i : nat, i < n -> h i < n) (e : forall i : nat, i < n -> g (h i) = i) (e0 : forall i : nat, i < n -> h (g i) = i), P (in_bij g h l l0 e e0)) -> forall b : bijection n g h, P b
bijection_rect : forall (n : nat) (g h : nat -> nat) (P : bijection n g h -> Type), (forall (l : forall i : nat, i < n -> g i < n) (l0 : forall i : nat, i < n -> h i < n) (e : forall i : nat, i < n -> g (h i) = i) (e0 : forall i : nat, i < n -> h (g i) = i), P (in_bij g h l l0 e e0)) -> forall b : bijection n g h, P b
sum_power_lt : forall (k n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), k <> 0 -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i < k) -> ∑ n (fun i : nat => f i * mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 i k) < mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 n k
sum_0n_le_one : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) (i : nat), i < n -> f i <= ∑ n f
composed_permutation_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : (nat -> nat) -> Prop), (forall g : nat -> nat, (forall i : nat, i < n -> g i = i) -> P g) -> (forall (g : nat -> nat) (i j : nat) (f0 h : nat -> nat), bounded_permut n i j f0 -> composed_permutation n h -> P h -> (forall i0 : nat, i0 < n -> g i0 = h (f0 i0)) -> P g) -> forall g : nat -> nat, composed_permutation n g -> P g
Inductive composed_permutation (n : nat) (g : nat -> nat) : Prop := in_cp_0 : (forall i : nat, i < n -> g i = i) -> composed_permutation n g | in_cp_1 : forall (i j : nat) (f h : nat -> nat), bounded_permut n i j f -> composed_permutation n h -> (forall i0 : nat, i0 < n -> g i0 = h (f i0)) -> composed_permutation n g Arguments composed_permutation _%nat_scope _%function_scope Arguments in_cp_0 [n]%nat_scope (_ _)%function_scope Arguments in_cp_1 [n]%nat_scope _%function_scope [i j]%nat_scope [f h]%function_scope _ _ _%function_scope
msum_ext : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (f g : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i = g i) -> msum m u n f = msum m u n g
sum_fold_map : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), ∑ n f = fold_right Init.Nat.add 0 (map f (list_an 0 n))
msum_sum : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (f g : nat -> X), (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> m (f j) (g i) = m (g i) (f j)) -> msum m u n (fun i : nat => m (f i) (g i)) = m (msum m u n f) (msum m u n g)
Newton_nat_S : forall a n : nat, mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 n (1 + a) = ∑ (S n) (fun i : nat => binomial.binomial n i * mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 i a)
Inductive bounded_injective (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) : Prop := in_bounded_inj : (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i < n) -> (forall i j : nat, i < n -> j < n -> f i = f j -> i = j) -> bounded_injective n f Arguments bounded_injective _%nat_scope _%function_scope Arguments in_bounded_inj [n]%nat_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
msum_msum : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n k : nat) (f : nat -> nat -> X), (forall i1 j1 i2 j2 : nat, i1 < n -> j1 < k -> i2 < n -> j2 < k -> m (f i1 j1) (f i2 j2) = m (f i2 j2) (f i1 j1)) -> msum m u n (fun i : nat => msum m u k (f i)) = msum m u k (fun j : nat => msum m u n (fun i : nat => f i j))
Inductive bounded_permut (n i j : nat) (g : nat -> nat) : Prop := in_nat_perm : i < n -> j < n -> g i = j -> g j = i -> (forall k : nat, k <> i -> k <> j -> k < n -> g k = k) -> bounded_permut n i j g Arguments bounded_permut (_ _ _)%nat_scope _%function_scope Arguments in_nat_perm [n i j]%nat_scope _%function_scope _ _ _ _ _%function_scope
msum_only_one : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X) (i : nat), i < n -> (forall j : nat, j < n -> i <> j -> f j = u) -> msum m u n f = f i
Newton_nat : forall a b n : nat, mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 n (a + b) = ∑ (S n) (fun i : nat => binomial.binomial n i * mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 (n - i) a * mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 i b)
msum_of_unit : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i = u) -> msum m u n f = u
msum_S : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), msum m u (S n) f = m (f 0) (msum m u n (fun n0 : nat => f (S n0)))
injective_composed_permutation : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), bounded_injective n f -> composed_permutation n f
msum_first_two : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), 2 <= n -> (forall i : nat, 2 <= i -> f i = u) -> msum m u n f = m (f 0) (f 1)
msum_ends : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, 0 < i <= n -> f i = u) -> msum m u (n + 2) f = m (f 0) (f (S n))
map_map : forall (A B C : Type) (f : A -> B) (g : B -> C) (l : list A), map g (map f l) = map (fun x : A => g (f x)) l
msum_mscal : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n k : nat) (f : nat -> X), (forall i j : nat, i < n -> j < n -> m (f i) (f j) = m (f j) (f i)) -> msum m u n (fun i : nat => mscal m u k (f i)) = mscal m u k (msum m u n f)
msum_plus : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (a b : nat) (f : nat -> X), msum m u (a + b) f = m (msum m u a f) (msum m u b (fun i : nat => f (a + i)))
msum_fold_map : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), msum m u n f = fold_right m u (map f (list_an 0 n))
sum_0n_scal : forall (X : Type) (sum : X -> X -> X) (zero : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x y : X, sum x y = sum y x) -> forall (n k : nat) (f : nat -> X), msum sum zero n (fun i : nat => mscal sum zero k (f i)) = mscal sum zero k (msum sum zero n f)
msum_unit : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall n : nat, msum m u n (fun _ : nat => u) = u
Nat.Odd = fun n : nat => exists m : nat, n = 2 * m + 1 : nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Odd _%nat_scope
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
msum_1 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall f : nat -> X, msum m u 1 f = f 0
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.N0 | S n' => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n') end : nat -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.of_nat _%nat_scope

``` 
intros n h g f H. intro bij. inversion bij as [n' g' h' Hg Hh Hgh Hhg].
unfold sum_nat.
rewrite sum_bounded_permutation with (g := g') (f := f).
rewrite sum_bounded_permutation with (g := h') (f := fun i => f (g' i)).
f_equal. apply functional_extensionality. intro i.
apply H. apply Hg. apply Hhg.
```

original: intros n h g f H. intro bij. inversion bij as [n' g' h' Hg Hh Hgh Hhg]. unfold sum_nat. rewrite sum_bounded_permutation with (g := g') (f := f). rewrite sum_bounded_permutation with (g := h') (f := fun i => f (g' i)). f_equal. apply functional_extensionality. intro i. apply H. apply Hg. apply Hhg.
